justification: The interviewee explicitly states they eat meat because it is filling, supporting their regular beef consumption.
The interviewee explicitly says they eat meat because it is the most convenient food, reinforcing regular beef consumption.
The interviewee cites nutritional value as a reason for eating meat, supporting regular beef consumption.
The interviewee explicitly attributes their and their family's regular beef eating habits to shared family lifestyle and business.
Convenience is described as a reason both the interviewee and their family continue to eat beef regularly.
Both filling quality and nutritional benefits are cited as reasons for meat eating, suggesting a supportive, though weak, connection.
Convenience and nutritional value are both named as main reasons for eating meat, implying a weak supportive relationship.
The interviewee mentions both filling quality and convenience as reasons to eat meat, suggesting these motivations reinforce each other.
Nutritional reasoning may play a role in the family's regular beef consumption, though this is only implied.
The family’s regular beef consumption is likely supported by shared beliefs about meat being filling, though this support is only implied.
